elements.name: LandingHeading
elements.html: LP/GOLPP Survey 2026

elements.name: LandingText
elements.html:
The goal of this survey is to collect information about you and your beloved animal companion's experience with the disease of laryngeal paralysis or GOLPP (Geriatric-Onset Laryngeal Paralysis and Polyneuropathy). To take the survey, you'll be required to remember details about your LP/GOLPP journey.

We know how hard it is to lose one's beloved companion. If your companion has recently crossed over the Rainbow Bridge, maybe it's best to do the survey later when you've had time to heal.

First, we'll explain what information we'll collect and how we'll ensure your privacy and data security. Then we'll ask for your consent to continue the survey. If at that point, you feel like talking about it would open too many wounds, we encourage you to stop and come back later when when you're ready.

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyHeading
elements.html: About your privacy and personal information

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText01
elements.html: We're not asking for your last name, so we have no way to connect you with any of your private data. We need only four pieces of information to ensure that we can verify survey results:

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText02
elements.html:
• Your first name
  • Your companion animal's name
  • The country in which you live
  • Your email address or Facebook account name

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText02
elements.html: With this info, we can ensure that all the survey respondents are unique and verifiable without having to collect any information that makes you identifiable outside the context of the survey. For details about how we'll use the data we collect and further steps we'll take to anonymize your contact information, select the 'About your privacy' and 'Consent information' links.

elements.name: LandingPrivacy
elements.html: About your privacy

elements.name: LandingData
elements.html: How will we be using your information?

elements.name: LandingConsentHeading
elements.html: By clicking the checkbox below, you confirm that you're ready to answer questions about your LP companion and consent to the terms of our privacy and consent statements.

elements.name: consent
elements.title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions?

elements.name: UserInfoHeading
elements.html: About You

elements.name: UserInfoText
elements.html: We're asking for contact info (email or Facebook account name), which country you live in, and some optional demographics to help us understand the people who are making choices for their beloved LP companions.

elements.name: UserInfoVerificationHeading
elements.html: Verification Contact

elements.name: UserInfoVerificationPanelText
elements.html:
We contact a random sample of respondents for verification purposes. You may or may not be contacted. You can provide an email address or, if you're more comfortable commicating via Facebook Messenger, you can provide your Facebook account name.

With your consent, we may also contact you to talk in more detail about your experience with LP.

elements.name: UserInfoContactType
elements.title: Would you like to use email or Facebook Messenger for verification?
Email address:
elements.name: UserInfoContactTypeEmail
UserInfoContactTypeFacebookInstructions
elements.title: z
elements.html: Please go to your Facebook account page and copy the URL, then paste it below. Example: https://facebook.com/my.user.name.

elements.title: Facebook account:
elements.name: UserInfoContactTypeFacebook

validators.text: Please enter a valid Facebook profile URL, e.g., https://facebook.com/your.username

elements.name: UserInfoContactOK
elements.title: May we contact you to talk more about your LP experience?

elements.name: UserInfoNameCountryHeading
elements.html: Your First Name and Country

elements.title: First Name:
elements.name: UserInfoFirstName
UserInfoCountry
elements.title: Country:

elements.name: UserInfoStateRegion
elements.title: What state, province or region do you live in (optional)

elements.name: UserInfoAgeGenderHeading
elements.html: Age and Gender (optional)

elements.name: UserInfoAgeGenderText
elements.html: We're asking for basic demographic information to help understand how different people manage the animals in their care.

elements.name: UserInfoAgeGroup
elements.title: Approximately what is your age?

elements.name: UserInfoGender
elements.title: Gender information:

elements.name: CmpnNameLifeStatusHeading
elements.html: About Your Companion Animal

elements.name: CmpnNameLifeStatusText
elements.html:
We know how hard it is to lose one's beloved companion. If you're still grieving from the loss, maybe it's best to do the survey later when you've had time to heal.

If you'd like to continue now, now please tell us your LP companion's name and if your LP companion has crossed over the Rainbow Bridge. This will allow us to tailor the questions to your individual situation.

elements.name: CmpnName
elements.title: Please tell us your companion's name:

elements.name: LifeStatusCrossedOver
elements.title: Has your companion crossed over the Rainbow Bridge?

elements.name: CmpnNameLifeStatusMakeSelection
elements.html: Once you've made your selection, please choose 'Next' to begin the survey.

elements.name: InfoSourcesHeading
elements.html: How did you learn about laryngeal paralysis (LP)?

elements.name: InfoSourcesText
elements.html: This section asks some questions about how you learned about LP and whether the information you found helped you make decisions for {CmpnName}. There is no right or wrong answer, so please answer as best as you can without thinking too hard about it.

elements.name: InfoSourcesPriorKnowledge
elements.title: Had you ever heard of LP before {CmpnName} got it?

elements.name: InfoSourcesTypes
elements.title: Which sources of information have you accessed to learn about LP?

choices.text: Reddit, X (Twitter), or other social media

elements.name: InfoSourcesBestSource
elements.title: Which of those information sources did you find MOST useful (please select one)?

elements.name: InfoSourcesHardToUnderstand
elements.title: Did you find the information you got about LP difficult to understand?
elements.description: 1 = no, not difficult at all, 5 = very difficult

elements.name: InfoSourcesContradictory
elements.title: Do you feel like a lot of the information you got about LP was contradictory?
elements.description: 1 = not at all contridictory, 5 = very contradictory

elements.name: InfoSourcesClearAnswers
elements.title: Did you find it hard to get clear answers to your questions so you could make informed choices for {CmpnName}?
elements.description: 1 = No, not hard at all, 5 = yes, very hard

elements.name: IntubationHistoryHeading
elements.html: Improper intubation can lead to damage to the larynx. These questions relate to {CmpnName}'s intubation history prior to LP/GOLPP symptoms.

elements.name: IntubationHistoryWasIntubated
elements.title: Had {CmpnName} been intubated under anesthesia for any reason in the 12 months prior to the first LP symptoms?

elements.name: IntubationHistoryReason
elements.title: For what reason was {CmpnName} intubated prior to the first LP symptoms appearing?

elements.name: IntubationHistoryConcerns
elements.title: Do you remember having any concerns about how the intubation/anesthesia affected {CmpnName}?

elements.name: IntubationHistorySymptoms
elements.title: What symptoms did {CmpnName} have after the intubation/anesthesia?

elements.name: BreathingCrisis
elements.html: LP Breathing Crisis

elements.name: BreathingCrisisText
elements.html: Breathing emergencies are terrifying.

elements.name: BreathingCrisisDidHave
elements.title: Did {CmpnName} ever have a breathing crisis that required an emergency visit to a veterinary professional?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} visit a veterinary professional due to an LP/GOLPP-associated breathing crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisCost
elements.title: About what was the total pre-insurance cost of these visits to veterinary professionals due to LP/GOLPP-induced breathing crises/emergencies?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisAdvice
elements.title: Did a veterinary professional give you any advice on how to deal with an LP-induced breathing emergency/crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisAdviceType
elements.title: What advice did they give you to help you deal with a breathing crisis?

choices.text: Get them to a cool place
Apply ice, a cooling vest, or some other cooling agent
Bring them to an emergency facility immediately

elements.name: BreathingCrisisProvidedSubstance
elements.title: Did a veterinary professional provide you with a substance or product to help deal with an LP/GOLPP-induced breathing emergency/crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisProvidedSubstanceType
elements.title: What substance or product did they provide?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisSubstanceForm
elements.title: In what form was the sedative or steriod provided?

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoHeading
elements.html: <h3>Tell us about your LarPar companion!<h3>

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoText
elements.html: This section asks basic questions about your companion's age, breed, weight, and demeanor. The answers are required to complete the survey. If you don't know exact information, it's OK to guesstimate. If you can't answer the questions at all, it's probably best to abort the survey and try again at a later date when you know more about your companion's circumstances.

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoAnimalType
elements.title: What kind of animal is {CmpnName}?

elements.title: What is {CmpnName}'s breed or breed mix and gender?

elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsHeading
elements.html: Your early encounters with laryngeal paralysis (LP)

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsText
elements.html: Most people know something's wrong with their companion before they know it's LP or even before they know there is such a thing as LP. This section asks questions about the early phase of your LP journey and how you came to accept that {CmpnName} might have it.

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsFirstSignsPanel
elements.title: About how old was {CmpnName} (in years and months) when you first noticed signs of what you later learned was LP?

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsAgeYears
elements.title: Years

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsAgeMonths
elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsType
elements.title: What symptoms did {CmpnName} have at that time?

elements.name: lvngEarlySymtomsSeverity
elements.title: How severe did you think {CmpnName}'s early symptoms were?

elements.name: lvngEarlySymptomsHindEndWeakness
elements.title: Was {CmpnName} already showing signs of hind-end weakness in this early stage?

elements.name: lvngErlyOtherConditions
elements.title: Which other conditions did {CmpnName} have when the first LP symptoms appeared?

elements.name: lvngChangedVetsHeading
elements.html: Did you change vets?(LP)

elements.name: lvngChangedVetsText
elements.html: Tell us why you changed vets.

elements.name: lvngChangedVets
elements.title: Did you ever change primary veterinarians because how they handled {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: lvngChangedVetsReason
elements.title: Why did you change veterinarians after {CmpnName} started showing symptoms of LP/GOLPP?:

elements.name: lvngChangedVetsAdvice
elements.title: What, if any, advice did your previous primary vet/s give you advice about dogname's LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: lvngChangedVetsSpecialistRecommendation
elements.title: What kind of specialist did your previous vet recommend or refer?

choices.text: Surgeon experienced in tieback or other LP surgery

elements.name: lvngChangeVetsConfidence
elements.title: How confident were you in your previous primary vet/s' knowledge level regarding LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = no confident at all, 5 = very confident

elements.name: lvngPrimaryDurationHeading
elements.html: How long were you in the care of a primary vet?(LP)

elements.name: lvngPrimaryDurationText
elements.html: Tells how long a primary vet was responsible for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP issues.

elements.name: lvngPrimaryDurationBeginYears
elements.title: Age in years (number):

elements.name: lvngPrimaryDurationBeginMonths
elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: lvngPrimaryDurationVisitsNumber
elements.title: About how many times did you visit a primary veterinarian (including your current one) about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: lvngPrimaryDurationCost
elements.title: About what was the total pre-insurance cost of these visits to primary veterinarians about dogname's LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetHeading
elements.html: About your current primary veterinarian(LP)

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetText
elements.html: Tell us about our experience with your current primary veterinarian.

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetDiagnosis
elements.title: Did your current primary vet give you a diagnosis of LP for {CmpnName}?

choices.text: No, did not mention LP/GOLPP at all.

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetDiagnosticType
elements.title: What diagnostic procedure did your current primary veterinarian use to arrive at their conclusion?

choices.text: Video endoscope or laryngoscope under anesthesia

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetInflammation
elements.title: Did your current primary veterinarian observe any inflammation, irritation, or infection in the larynx/pharynx area?

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetPrescriptions
elements.title: Did your current primary veterinarian provide any prescription medications for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetPrescriptionType
elements.title: What prescription medications if any did your primary veterinarian prescribe or recommend for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetPrescriptionEffectiveness
elements.title: How effective were these prescription medicatons for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = not at all effective, 5 = very effective

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetNonPrescription
elements.title: Did your current primary veterinarian provide or recommend any non-prescription treatments or therapies for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?:

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetNonPrescriptionType
elements.title: What non-prescription treatments (not including OTC supplements) did your current primary veterinarian recommend?

choices.text: Cold laser or red light therapy

elements.name: lvngPrimaryVetNonPrescriptionEffectiveness
elements.title: How effective were these treatments?
elements.description: 1 = not at all effective, 5 = very effective
